description:
PSA: This Course will no longer be available June 30th 2016 onwards
                            Coursera announced that they will be shutting off their old platform on June 30th. Over  400 courses that are part
                                of the old stack will be no longer be available. You can find the  complete list here.
                            
                            

                            
                                Read this guide to learn how to download this course before the old platform shuts down. 

                                The guide provides two ways to download the courses - Chrome Plugin and Python Script. Depending on which method you use, check the appropriate sections below for further details.
                            
                            
                            
                                To download this course you need to be enrolled in the course.
                                                                Unfortunately this course is closed for enrollment to new students. If you hadn't signed up before, you will not be able to download the course.
                                

                                                            

                            Chrome Plugin

                                                                If you had signed up for this course you will be able to download and save the course materials using the chrome plugin. Click on Go To Class and Log in to your Coursera account to do so.
                            
                            Python Script
                            
                                                                For the python script to work you will need a class name. Pick one from below:
                                                                    cc2lit-001
                                
                                
                                If more than one class name below, pick the last one. If the script fails, pick the one above that and try again. Not all of these class names are guranteed to work.


                            






                        
                    
                    The Common Core State Standards are
new and will challenge our students to show evidence of learning in new
ways.  Instructional shifts are required, especially for teachers who must
now incorporate literacy into content areas. Integrating the literacy standards
can be difficult to do well. In this course you will have the support of a
community and harness the power of collaboratively exchanging ideas with
colleagues, as you explore a variety of Literacy Design Collaborative tools to
align curriculum with the Common Core.
 
Each week you’ll explore one aspect of the Literacy Design Collaborative model,
choosing from a variety of resources to differentiate for your own learning. You’ll
then participate in a discussion forum to share you insights, questions, and
applications with others. 

                                            Syllabus
                        This course will include
exploration of the Template Task, LDC Core Tools, Mini-Tasks, and the Mini-Task
Library. Participants will differentiate for their own learning by considering
the application of one of these aspects of the LDC model.

Requirements
for course completion include:

·     
Pre and post course surveys

·     
12 discussion forum posts

·     
End of the course plan for application

·     
Assessment of 2-3 of your peer’s plans (rubrics are provided)
title: Common Core in Action II: Exploring Literacy Design Collaborative Tools
